issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Description:
While testing KitchenSink,Phone>Sound>Audio session mode, I could not get the iPod to play in the "record and play" mode. This may be due to the lack of microphone on the iPod 3rd gen. 

Steps to reproduce:
1) Install KS (SDK 1.7.X) onto device
2) Navigate to Phone>Sound>Audio
3) Set audio mode to "record and play" mode
4) Attempt to play

Result:
No sound

Expected Result:
Sound plays

Notes:
OCCURS on 1.6.2
fields.summary: iOS: KitchenSink: Phone>Sound>Audio session mode, iPod will not play sound in "record and play" mode.
fields.environment: iPod Touch 3rd Gen (4.0.2) , Titanium Studio, build: 1.0.0.201106011734, Titanium SDK version: 1.7.X rc9515533

comments.body:
IT OCCURS  TOO ON :
Titanium Studio, build: 2.1.2.201208301612
Titanium Studio SDK, build:2.1.3.v20120918170114
Devices:
iPad 3 -iOS6
iPhone 6 -iOS6
Note: No playback could be heard after recording. existing issue.
Closing ticket as invalid as this version of Kitchen Sink is no longer in use.
